TopicTitle: Truck and Trailer,Lamborghini Countach,AMG 6x6 and more

Articles.Content:
Truck and Trailer / 716parts max speed=75m/s(vv my mod list below vv)

Hi its a long time ago but im back ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

here is my first of manny ''real'' car's and other realish stuff 

398 part's and lots of mods, max speed 90m/s opening doors and hood

sorry for my bad spelling im dutch ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sWblZZkeDnE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

372 parts max speed 100m/s

Mod's i use

Aviation Lights

BahaSP

BDArmory

BDynamics

DMagic Orbital Science

Dr. Jets Chop Shop

Firespitter

KAX

Kerbal Foundries Wheels and Repulsors

MI Fuel Tank Expansion

Modular MultiWheels

QuizTechAero

Throttle Controlled Avionics

SurfaceLights

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T08:15:42Z" title="08/02/2015 08:15  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by renePRO**

Nicely done, what mod do you use for the wheels?

Glad to see nice auto replica by someone else than this Viagrani dude

Hi and thanks for the feedback 

this is the mod for the wheels: Kerbal Foundries Wheels and Repulsors

i love that mod it got working cilinders, te more u place the faster u go

Those are the Touhou Torpedo truck wheels. Not a bad choice but the car wheels are better.

Best aardig maar die Lambo is te smal en te hoog.

Bedankt 

ik had nog niet van Touhou Torpedo truck wheels gehoord, maar die wielen lijken inderdaad veel op die van Kerbal Foundries Wheels and Repulsors

My Trike:cool:

101 parts

Ouch ... 75 m/s for a truck & trailer ... that's 270 km/h!

You must have some very impatient customers!

> 
> Ouch ... 75 m/s for a truck & trailer ... that's 270 km/h!
> You must have some very impatient customers!

Without the trailer it wil go 120m/s 432km/h:confused:

Tailgating Veyron drivers in a semi truck. Ahhh, progress.
